description:
I walked past four or five breakfast spots that had lines out the door or were too small to sit down in before I made my way to Westfield mall to run my errand. After passing by many lunch spots that seemed unappealing, I happened upon Caffe Central. Lots of choices at this little place in the center of the food court in the basement. 

They have inventive breakfast items, pastries, sandwiches, salads and beverages along with fresh fruit--something for everyone. They appear to serve these items throughout the day, so if you are seeking a breakfast item outside of the typical timeframe (as I was at 11am) this is the place to visit. Prices are reasonable. 

Had the quiche Lorraine for $8.50 and it was just the portion I was looking for. I would have gotten the kale cauliflower quiche but I couldn't determine--and they didn't know for sure if it had any cheese in it. Cheese is a must have in my quiche! One improvement is that It could have used a minute more in the reheat process because there were a couple of slightly less warm spots inside, but the flavor was very good and spoke to homemade, quality ingredients. 

I would visit again if I'm in town and want a quick, tasty meal for a reasonable price.
author: B L J.

description:
This is my second time at this place. The person who rang me has been the same both the times and I've noticed that each time I've gone hereshe has been rude. Second time around I got boba tea.  I asked for coffee flavor and she asked if I want tea or green tea base and she asked twice as I didn't get it the first time ( and IMHO she sounded even more frustrated the second time) and she didn't ask me how much ice or sugar I wanted. I also didn't mention as I thought they would ask me at some point.It is a norm AT ALL boba places I've visited to ask these two simple questions. They show you a chart and enter it in the system. But, no this place doesn't do it. 

When the lady was making it I saw her add lots of ice so I asked her very politely to remove it. So this lady at the cashier comes and uses a condoning tone and says I should've told her. I mean are you the boba shop or me? How am I supposed to know your process? I normally add a tip, but her tone was not nice so I didn't add anything and I am glad I didn't. 

Anyway the tea was actually good, but too sweet!
I would give Negative stars for service.
author: Sakshi G.

description: Looking for a place after lunch to chit chat with my gal pals but things have changed in the Westfield shopping center.  The dessert places in the Rotunda are gone and so we went back downstairs and noticed that things have changed in the Food Court!  But there was still Caffe Central and so I ordered a nice hot cup of tea which was calming my queasy stomach (from eating too many different foods from my birthday).  It was a soothing and relaxing tea that I enjoyed.  They have a large menu with desserts, boba tea and food to eat but all I wanted was some soothing tea and it hit the spot.  I can't remember the name of the tea but it was organic!
author: Karen W.

description:
# 4 Caffee Central *Rod Boba SF Rating * 7/8 *Rod's Yelp Rating *4 stars

I had to re-do this review because I came across the "other" location and realized that I had tried both locations.

This one is inside the Westfield Shopping mall and looks to be very popular. I noticed many people getting the milktea/boba even though there were other options. I then recalled that I had been to the location and Offarrell. 

My initial rating was 7/8 and I'm going to stick with that although I must admit that the second time wasn't as good as what I remembered from the first visit at the Union Sq Location. Perhaps  I got a less fresh batch of boba?? Anyways, I'll give this location the benefit of the doubt. 

Rod M tours San Francisco in search of the BEST standard milk tea with boba. I have individual reviews for all the places listed below.  Check out my latest reviews for the most up to date list.

I recently embarked on a completely pointless quest to rank most of the Milk Tea/Boba Places in the area.

Rules: I ordered a simple milk tea with Boba (regular sweetness, ice etc.)

Ranking explained:  #1 (listed at the top)  is my favorite/ #30  (listed at the bottom) is my least favorite.

Rod Boba SF Rating = (Taste of Milk Tea / Taste of Tapioca Balls) on a Scale of 1 to 10 (10/10) being the best score possible
* Please note that I like my boba a little bit sweet. I don't like it too milky, too strong of a tea taste or too watery.  I prefer fresh tasting larger "boba".  Powdery drinks (those places that simply have a plastic carafe that they pour out of ) and boba that tastes "old" get docked on my rating scale.

# 1 Itea *Rod Boba SF Rating * 9/9 *Rod's Yelp Rating *5 stars
# 2 Puppy bobar *Rod Boba SF Rating * 8/8 *Rod's Yelp Rating *5 stars
# 3 Asha Tea House *Rod Boba SF Rating * 7/9 *Rod's Yelp Rating *4 stars
# 4 Caffee Central *Rod Boba SF Rating * 7/8 *Rod's Yelp Rating *4 stars
# 5 Cool Tea  *Rod Boba SF Rating * 7/8 *Rod's Yelp Rating *4 stars
# 6 The Boba Shop *Rod Boba SF Rating * 7/7 *Rod's Yelp Rating *4 stars
# 7 Good Earth Café *Rod Boba SF Rating * 7/7 *Rod's Yelp Rating *4 stars
# 8 Hanlin Tea *Rod Boba SF Rating * 6/7 *Rod's Yelp Rating *4 stars
# 9 Keep it *Rod Boba SF Rating * 6/6 *Rod's Yelp Rating *4 stars
# 10 Wonder Tea *Rod Boba SF Rating * 6/6 *Rod's Yelp Rating *4 stars
# 11 Enter the Café *Rod Boba SF Rating * 6/6 *Rod's Yelp Rating *4 stars
# 12 Tpumps *Rod Boba SF Rating * 5/7 *Rod's Yelp Rating *4 stars
# 13 The Ramen Bar *Rod Boba SF Rating * 6/5 *Rod's Yelp Rating *3 stars
# 14 Eightea *Rod Boba SF Rating * 6/5 *Rod's Yelp Rating *3 stars
# 15 Enter the Café *Rod Boba SF Rating * 5/6 *Rod's Yelp Rating *4 stars
# 16 Tea Hut *Rod Boba SF Rating * 5/5 *Rod's Yelp Rating *3 stars
# 17 Sharetea *Rod Boba SF Rating * 5/5 *Rod's Yelp Rating *3 stars
# 18 Tanca *Rod Boba SF Rating * 5/5 *Rod's Yelp Rating *3 stars
# 19 Boba Guys *Rod Boba SF Rating * 5/5 *Rod's Yelp Rating *3 stars
# 20 Steep (not Steap) *Rod Boba SF Rating * 5/5 *Rod's Yelp Rating *3 stars
# 21 T&T Café *Rod Boba SF Rating * 5/5 *Rod's Yelp Rating *3 stars
# 22 Bobo Drinks & Pho *Rod Boba SF Rating * 5/5 *Rod's Yelp Rating *3 stars
# 23 Samovar Tea *Rod Boba SF Rating * 5/5 *Rod's Yelp Rating *2 stars
# 24 E Tea *Rod Boba SF Rating * 4/6 *Rod's Yelp Rating *2 stars
# 25 Steap (not Steep) *Rod Boba SF Rating * 4/5 *Rod's Yelp Rating *2 stars
# 26 Maggies Café *Rod Boba SF Rating * 4/4 *Rod's Yelp Rating *2 stars
# 27 Sweet Heart Café *Rod Boba SF Rating * 4/4 *Rod's Yelp Rating *2 stars
# 28 Honeycreme *Rod Boba SF Rating * 4/4 *Rod's Yelp Rating *2 stars
# 29 Elixiria *Rod Boba SF Rating * 4/4 *Rod's Yelp Rating *2 stars
# 30 Quickly *Rod Boba SF Rating * 4/4 *Rod's Yelp Rating *2 stars
# 31 Plentea *Rod Boba SF Rating * 4/4 *Rod's Yelp Rating *2 stars
# 32 Mi tea *Rod Boba SF Rating * 3/3 *Rod's Yelp Rating *2 stars
author: Rod M.

description:
Came here a few days ago in the evening. 
I ordered a thai tea with boba - the size was definitely worth the price and the flavor was great. 
The boba was cooked right as well!
The service was amazing and I'll definitely stop by again whenever I go shopping at Westfield!
author: Gabby O.

description: Healthy Choices to choose from... Had the avocado with fried Open face sandwich with green tea.. .. a good place to grab some quick meal in the city.. reasonably price too
author: Donovan L.

description: I came here for lunch while I was at the mall. I haven't been to their other location but I pass it every day so figured I'd give this one a try. I got the croque madame and an iced almond milk latte. Both were excellent and service was pretty quick. The croque madame tasted fresh and the flavor was on point. I would definitely come back here to try more, especially their pastries!
author: Pooja C.

description: First time here! Pretty cool little spot inside Westfield. A little slow but they were busy. Sandwich was good and fresh. Loved it!!!
author: Monica W.

description: After looking at the reviews for Caffè central about the bubble tea, I was quite the skeptic about the quality. However, since filled the card for Caffè central (buy 9, get 1 free deal), I decided to take a chance. I got the honey green tea bubble tea and thankfully, the bubble pearls were freshly made so they were super soft and chewy. The tea is a bit sweet to my taste, but that's what I get for ordering honey. I took off a star since the service was subpar. The cashier wasn't so nice (overwhelmed I bet) and she didn't return my Caffè central punch card back.
author: Shelley C.

description:
I had terrible service here. The cashier lady rushed me while I was ordering my food and then told me that they were out of an item I saw the guy behind me order and receive. When I finally got my egg avocado toast, they forgot the salad that came along with it. My partner went back to get it, but they demanded to see a receipt which they NEVER gave us. It was only after my partner bothered them enough that they gave us a tiny serving of salad which I finished in 4 bites. It was supposed to be a $3 salad and the avocado toast was $7, but it was literally just one tiny piece of toast with avocado, bean sprouts, and a fried egg on it. I also finished this in 4 bites. 

Long story short, the food is overpriced and the service is terrible. Save your money and go somewhere else.
author: Michelle L.

description:
This review is only for the boba milk tea. They only use syrups for all their flavors. They also charge my lactose-intolerant homies $1.00 to substitute in non-dairy milk (and the god of non-dairy milks, hazelnut milk isn't even an option!!). 

I've also never been to a boba place where the boba pearls got stuck in the straw (see image below). I don't know what that says about the straw or what it says about the boba, but somethings not right here. The boba pearls were actually surprisingly sweet, but the overall experience was not that great.

Worth a try though :/
author: Vasiliy M.

description:
Terrible service!  Some lazy employees, especially the lady making the milk teas. I can't comment on the guy making the coffee since I didn't order any. It took a good 10-15 mins just to get 3 orders of original green milk teas with aloe vera (no boba), and there was only 2 other orders ahead of me. The lady was too busy chit chatting with her co-worker, then talked on her cell phone. And when they ran out of aloe vera and could only make 2 drinks with aloe, so the third drink was with rainbow jelly instead. I asked the lady to make 1 regular sweetness and the other less sweet with aloe, and the 3rd regular sweetness with rainbow jelly. Instead of saying "ok," or "no problem", she argues with me and says that she already mixed the two regular sweet ones so she can't do that. She hasn't even poured them into the cups yet (they were still in the mixing container) so it was just a matter of getting another cup, putting rainbow jelly in it and then pouring into that cup along with one of the cups with aloe. What's so difficult?? And it's not my fault you ran out of aloe vera. Why did she feel the need to make the 2 orders with regular sweetness with aloe and the less sweet drink HAS to be with rainbow jelly?? She isn't the one drinking it, it's me the customer.

Anyhow, the drinks were ok, not the best but not the worst either.

Their other location right next to Ellis O'Farrell parking garage has much better service so I will go to that one in the future if I'm in union square and want some milk tea.
author: T H.

description:
BOBA BOBA BOBA

Finding this place was a bit interesting: 

I was out and about in San Francsico marking all the boba places that were in the city. I was deciding where I should go to and what I should try. I even made a decision to go to one shop, but it turned out that store was going to be open at 12pm. It was merely 9:45am. Obviously, I had to find boba somewhere else. 

After watching El Clasico at Thirsty Bear Brewery, I made my way back to the Powell Bart Station, I found my way into the Westfield Shopping Center and went down the escalators to the food court. I had settled with buying this Ramune drink from Bristol Farms. I also decided to just by lunch in one of the many eateries on this floor. 

Nothing caught my eye until I came upon the menu for Caffe Central. Yelp surprisingly didn't show me that this place had boba so it didn't come in my search when I typed in boba. But there it was on the menu in clear writing that said, "Boba." EKKKKK I was so excited. If there's boba, I must try it!

Their collection of flavors isn't as big as other boba shops, but it makes sense. This place doesn't focus solely on milk tea. Their flavors are: Original, Taro, Thai, Honey, Almond, Caramel, Coffee, Coconut, etc. They also had some cookies, sandwiches, and salads along with some coffee, tea, and juice. 

Let me just tell you that the people I met working there were nice. They were quick and efficient. I don't think I had to wait even a minute before my name was called with my order. Oh, I ordered Taro. They didn't have any cookies and cream flavor so of course I went for their Taro. Cost wasn't too bad for a pretty large size of 24 oz. I only paid $4.25. 

WHOA. This place actually has the best taro milk tea with boba compared to the other milk tea/bubble tea/boba stores I've been too so far. This wasn't bland at all as taro can be if made incorrectly. The milk mixed well with the taro. It created this lovely and almost soft kind of sweetness to the drink. I didn't feel like I would get hyper because of the amount of sugar in the drink. Instead, I felt very relaxed. There was however a lot of ice, and that did make my drink a bit watery towards that last few sips. They happen to also use standard boba. That didn't taste any different to the ones I've stated at ShareTea. 

A nice little hidden gem of a spot for the bubble tea lover.
author: Alexa T.

description: Average. Not great, not bad. We had Thai Thea Boba and a caramel latte. Service is quick. But nothing spectacular. It's a good location, located across from Macy's.
author: Ha D.

description: Cafe Central offers unique coffees and special yummy pastries. Everything I have tried here have been good so far. The employees here are very nice and friendly too. Its the place to get fresh coffee and a sweet snack after a long day of shopping at Westfield Mall. There's a lot of seating areas too since its at the food court.
author: Stephanie L.

description:
That dark-haired cashier with the half-rim hipster glasses was super rude to me. I stood there for about 30 seconds while he pretended to ignore me. He was much nicer to other customers, though. I asked him about two different drinks, and he didn't look like he wanted to help me decide. I asked the right questions, but he had dumb, condescending reponses. It seemed he knew way less about the drinks than I did - and he works there. Or at least, he just didn't want to give me the good, helpful info he'd give to others. 

This place is nice if they like you based on superficial appearances, a snap judgement, and rude if they don't like you. I'm just like any other customer who walks up to that place, but as usual, they were nasty and judgmental to me only. I saw others getting much better treatment from the same cashier. He didn't even thank me or say a parting phrase. I'm surprised but not so surprised by the reviews here that say they give friendly service. People naturally give friendly and warm service if they like and look up to you, however you look at that moment. And the more they dislike you based on superficial appearances, the worse treatment you'll get. 

I expected this place to have the Square register stand, like other places with their vibe. But it didn't have the Square thing, which makes cashiers treat each customer more fairly because asking for a tip is more in-your-face. With the Square thing, cashiers often turn the iPad-like device over to the customer, who can choose whether to give a tip of $1, $2, or more. But because this place just used a standard register, asking for a tip isn't so obvious and in-your-face for cashiers, so they're not as nice to every customer. When a tip isn't expected or wanted, they just treat the ones they like better, and the ones they look down on worse. That's extremely unfair, and extremely painful. They don't even know me, and they're judging me to death. 

That barista was very indifferent, but he wasn't  quite as bad as the cashier or most employees toward me. At least when the barista saw me waiting there, he helped me immediately instead of pretending not to notice, like most employees. 

This place has very differential service towards different customers, so it's left a very bad taste in my mouth. It's very overpriced, too. $7 for a tiny cake, and served with terrible presentation that doesn't match its high prices - on an ugly, cheap-looking plate. Very overpriced, mediocre drinks, too. A fail.
author: S F.

description: Waiters all seemed to be in a bad mood. Make the milk tea wrong with adding unnecessary bubbles the first time, and after took the bubbles out, they pour only ice cubes in, and there was already enough ice cubes before. So we got a cup of milk tea with 50% ice cubes, and YES, it still not filled the whole cup. Unevenly heat the sandwich/bread, hot outside, cold inside. And the food there was not tasting.
author: Skylar H.

description:
I've been here countless times in the past 5 years, usually 3x a month, I get the same thing each time. The daily lunch special. It's $7.50 for half of a sandwich (generous portion) and a few scoops of whatever salad you want. I typically go for the beet. In the office is known as "the Jeff special". Considering the price, the speed, and somewhat healthy (somewhat because there's a lot of bread), I'm giving this page 4 stars because of this specifically because of this combo. 

Here's a beginner's guide for first timers coming here. 

1) if there's a line, get in line and figure out what you want. Or if you want the Jeff special just say. "daily special, with beets, not toasted, to go". 

2) order and pay 

3) go to the right side of counter where the water is. Get some some of the water which has lemon in it from the free cups and wait for your order. 

One caveat. Avoid the barley kale. I've tried it 4 times and twice there was grit.
author: Jeff C.

description:
Was starving so got the tuna bowl (which was good) and an open faced salmon n cream cheese sandwich. Barely picked at the sandwich. Salmon looked suspect. Was pissed by this time after asking for a cup of ice water. The girl Hong gives me Luke warm water w no ice. I asked for ice again and she says they have no ice. Afterwards I see other people with iced tea, iced coffee and so forth.. really you can't give me ice cuz you think I'm being cheap after spending $18 for lunch here. 
Don't think I'll be back anytime soon!
author: Theresa H.

description: This review is for the boba milk tea...which was awful! I ordered the almond milk tea with boba and the boba itself was fine but the drink just tasted like water with little bit of milk. I will not be getting boba here again.
author: Mai N.

description: Terrible coffee and terrible service. They got our coffee order wrong. When we brought it to their attention they argued about it and would not remake the order. Very rude employees
author: Brian A.

description:
I come to Westfield so often these days, especially after work on days I decide to walk through the food court to get to the BART station. However, it was only recently that I decided to check out Caffe Central; maybe because I never paid enough attention to the drinks menu to notice they served boba. But I am so glad I did finally. I ordered their Thai boba tea in a large size twice in one week. It is probably the biggest boba cup I've ever had. I didn't have to wait for more than 5 minutes. The drink comes to me with the milk on top. I like that, because I find it fun to mix it altogether. Plus the boba pearls are pretty amazing, definitely exceeded my initial expectations. Apparently this cafe is run by Asians so that explains it. ;) 
Oh and if you like iced Vietnamese coffee, it's got that too. I'll have to try that next time. 
I also noticed tons of single serving desserts like macarons, tiramisu, and fruit tarts. There is also a whole counter full of breakfast & lunch sandwiches. Oh and different kinds of poke (tuna and salmon if I recall). 
Overall, this place is a great find for me, and I'd love to try a sandwiches with an iced coffee next time. Mmmm...
author: Alice S.

description: Whenever we come to the city we are sure to stop here! The Cuban Lattes are the best and the owner is always friendly. They have great latte art and the sandwiches are good too if you're looking for something to eat.
author: Kimi P.

description: Premixed chai + milk is just just too sweet. Very little chai spice flavor. Vietnamese coffee doesn't taste like what it should. Thai tea with boba is decent.
author: One D.

description: 01-14-18, During the early afternoon, my wife and I popped in for a cappuccino to warm up and wake up, lol.  The location is small and a bit hidden near the parking garage on O'Farrell Street.  You order at the counter and pick up your order back at the counter. I ordered two cappuccinos and a small ham/Swiss on a fresh French roll.  The cappuccinos were in a nice size cup and were very tasty. My wife and I split the small sandwich, which we both enjoyed on the French roll. The price was average and worth our purchases.  The location was clean, and more importantly the bathroom was very clean.  If your near Macy's and want a quick pick me up, I recommend trying Caffe Central.
author: Jacky P.

description: Love how they brew their hot coffee, instead of using a fancy machine they use paper filters and piping hot water and make coffee magic in a matter of time. Their coffee was rather bold and strong but it kept me in check and awake for the rest of my shopping trip in the mall.
author: Jason C.

description:
Wife had a coffee, I had a tea. Both were average. I didn't even finish the tea.

Tables were average, and cleaners even shoved me as they rearranged tables. The place seemed fine overall, but nothing that really impressed me.
author: Dan D.

description: Fucking terrible service，I wouldn't be there again. Makes me feel awful.
author: Annan P.

description:
I love this place! Among the food court, this place offers a good quality of sandwich and salad! All of them are fresh!
Desert is also good! I would recommend their daily special! Half sandwich + half salad for 8 bucks. Expresso bar is also good! I've tried their drip, coffee bean quality is also as good as blue bottle. And another tip is by the end of the day, a lot of items are half off!
author: Nina H.

description: One of my favorite go-to place when I need a snack or a light meal. The workers here are very friendly and nice. Food is great. I love their bobas, I always get their Honeydew milk tea and their ham and cheese croissant.
author: Diether O.

description:
Asked the lady at the register what to drink. She said cold brew but I had the New Orleans cold brew earlier today at Blue Bottle and didn't like it. So, she rang me up for an ice Cuban latte and Two Faced Tuna (not warmed up, it's hot outside!) 13$ total. Ouch! 

The mouth watering tuna sandwich that looked so pretty I was scared to eat it. It was called two faced tuna...which made me say a little prayer for the killed fish I ate. Sad thing about the almost perfect pricey small portioned sandwich is that the edged of the bread were dried out. 

I watched eye candy with an accent make my iced Cuban and he called out my name it sounded like I was on a beach somewhere. Slowly put the lid on it after taking a sip of a-little-too sweet heaven and hesitantly backed away from the counter....taking a spot nearby so I could stalk a little longer. 

Come here for coffee and eye candy.
author: Monique W.

description: Coffee was really good. Have not tried anything else but if you want good coffee this is a great option.
author: R B.

description: I came here when I was in San fran visiting family. I was soooo tired from walking around all day and really needed something with caffeine. This is conveniently located inside of a beautiful mall right in the middle of a super large awesome food court. There was a line at the time, however, service was super fast and friendly. I got a "columbian latte" which we dont have where I live. I believe its like a regular just made with columbian coffee. The drink was very smooth and not too hot which I loved. If i was ever back in the area I would go again.
author: Lisa B.

description: I will give 0 stars if I could. I took a to-go salad and their CRedit Card machine had a glitch. The guy at the counter wasted my 10 mins. trying to fix it. Eventually I offered to the salad because they weren't able to charge and I had to catch a movie, and the guy happily took that back. I would have appreciated some courtesy there, they could have given it complimentary because it really wasn't my fault. Guess they don't know what customer service means!
author: S L.

description: Great caffe lots of choices for salads sandwiches, drinks and sweets. Their daily special is such a great deal- much better in price and portion compared to Panera Bread. Will definitely come back.
author: Von R.

description: When I was visiting San Francisco, I decided to get coffee at this establishment. The Asian lady (Jeanette)  who worked at the front was EXTREMELY RUDE!! When I asked for a change in my order she gave me a cold glare and almost chucked the receipt at my hands! Coffee is subpar... Would not recommend this place unless you like bad treatment.
author: Do K.

description: Coffee. Mmmmm. Good. Big Russian dude made my cappuccino. I thought he was going to put some vodka in it to make Black Friday pass quicker.
author: Kenson K.

description:
Working it's way into the weekly rotation for my team at work. The sandwich+salad combo is a sweet deal.

Slim Fit salad is usually my go to, but the last time I ordered, the orange wedges tasted very tart--not a nice complement. I picked them out.

The cuban coffee is a great way to treat yourself to something better than that usual office drip.

Haven't tried the desserts but they *look* pretty awesome.
author: Paolo V.

description: sf mall basement food court...center closer to bloomingdales...preferred stop for drinks and snacks...juices, blue bottle coffee drinks, boba, sandwiches, salads, etc...the variety of food items and drink items are vast...from pastries to toasted sandwiches...a taro milk tea with boba tasting standard...a good drink...juices ice cold...blue bottle coffee mixed drinks are pre-made and bit overrated....salads, wraps and sandwiches are fairly all good choices...
author: Hen A.

description: Even in a city like San Francisco, you don't always find a Cuban coffee, Gibraltar, Vietnamese, cold brew, and similar drinks of their kind on the menu in both hot and iced forms. The mall setting means that its atmosphere is essentially that of the Westfield food court it calls home. But staff is great and they will make you a kick-ass espresso beverage that sometimes is enough in itself to make your day.
author: Casey S.

description: i love this place. the boba is amazing and the drinks are so good! the boba is on the softer side (which i love) but some people don't. really nice staff
author: Alyssa F.

description:
Update 8-20-15...

Went to get a piece of pumpkin bread for a friend. The weird looking owner guy turned me away and refused to serve me because of my review on YELP. My opinion, you shouldn't do bad service and serve bad uncooked food and then get mad that people are upset! But honestly, Im not upset about 1 Caffe place when there are tons in SF which are better and won't make you sick. If you have a weak stomach, go somewhere else. They should serve free Pepto Bismal to everyone after they order.


I work in the mall, so this place is convenient. The staff aren't that friendly most times though. If you don't tip them they will remember you next time hahaha. The food is just ok. I found the tuna sandwich to be pretty good but sometimes tastes like freezer or refrigerator taste. 


****Update**** I went in for one last try on 2-28-15 since I work in the building. I hadn't eaten all day so I ordered the tuna sandwich. Everything seemed ok until about hour later. I got super sick! Vomiting violently and went home early sick. I literally had to vomit out all the contents of that horrible tuna sandwich!!! I called the following day and talked to the manager tried to diagnose me with some other sickness rather than food poisoning. She scoffed and said our tuna is not made in-house, it's made at the main location so she has no clue what they do there. She said there is nothing that she can do. I'm already exploring my options!

In the meantime, do not eat there!!!!! You will get extremely sick with no accountability on their part.
author: Brandon J.

description: Cafe Central is a great place to get a quick bite to eat and get good coffee and milk tea. However the middle aged white man who must own this place is a huge asshole. he is never in a good mood when i see him in there and he is always talking down customers orders and swearing on the sales floor. he i  general makes me uncomfortable, if he is in there i go to Starbucks. the saving grace is the employees and the large food selection.
author: Samantha G.

description:
I work in the mall, and I come here all the time to get boba! 

I especially love their Jasmine and taro milk tea. 
Here are their pricings:
Regular size $3.50
Large size $4.50
 Sounds like a lot, but their cup sizes are bigger than most places so you get your money worth.

Also! By 8pm, they have their salad and pastries 1/2 off!! A late and cheap dinner would do!

Cheers!
author: Inge C.

description:
This review is based on the service. 

The line was not that long with 5 people in front of me. I had been recommended by a friend the day before to try the Cuban condense milk latte. 

When I came to the register I asked the gentleman about the recommended drink. He gave me the answer that "it sweet... If you like that" kind of answer. Okay, so I proceeded to check out and then ask about the bagged beans to buy and what he recommended. He answers, "this one is what we use here is good and the others I'm not sure." Then just stared at me ... Well I guess I didn't have much information to go off of, although I know I had a limited window to get information. My feelings were he thought I wasn't going to purchase it, but I ended up getting one of the Blue Bottle'd bags (because it's Blue Bottle) to try and he was surprised. 

No reinforcement as a sales/customer service related person myself. And I tipped because I know this industry well. 

I think this Caffé is really cute but the service they are worker bees and no knowledge of what products they are selling/serving because I asked other questions to buy more and was given one worded responses ... Not sure I'll be coming back let alone trusting of the food.
author: David D.

description:
I really like Caffe Central. I come here almost every day for lunch and they never let me down. I always get the special because I can choose any salad I want (and they have many) and the focaccia bread is delicious. I don't much care for the tuna sandwich, but it's delicious all the same and for the price (under $7) it's the best meal you'll get in the Westfield Food Court.

Not to mention their desserts look delicious (I have yet to try one only because I am frugal) and they serve delicious Blue Bottle Coffee. 

I recommend Caffe Central to anyone who is in the mall and wants something happy and healthy and delicious to eat.
author: Drago F.

description: Delicious Corn & Kale salad. I go here after a long day at work when I don't want mall junk food. Generally service is good but this evening the person at the register got my order wrong, almost bent my credit card trying to swipe it over and over, and peered over the register as I was signing the credit card slip, either to inspect the tip I was giving her or to otherwise treat me with suspicion. Not an inviting experience.
author: James L.

description: Only been a few times but bad every time. Boba tea had some issue with the syrup last time I came which was over a year ago. They had to remake it, and gave it back to me luke warm and iceless. I ended up just asking for my money back. Today, I tried again. Totally unclear where line started, stocky jock guy behind counter looking unhappy and unconcerned totally ignored me. Other register person who was helping others was nice though. But in the end I was just disoriented and uncomfortable with the customer service from the other guy, so I left and took my business elsewhere again. It's just a coffee shop. I don't know why it is so difficult every time.
author: Scott S.

description: The dessert was just okay, but the sandwich was terrible. I ordered a humus avocado open faced sandwich with sprouts. They TOASTED it. Yes, you heard right. The sprouts were all burned and dried out. No common sense here.
author: Ed T.

description:
I try to find an email to contact the business directly but
there is nothing I could find online.

I bought the roasted beef sandwich and kale salad for my boyfriend and
gave him this for dinner and this caused him to get FOOD POISING.

I am utterly upset, and hope to receive a full on refund as well as
sometime of apologize. He threw up all the food he had exactly the
items I bought him and had to cancel an important meeting for work
since he is sick now. Very awful. 
Hope to hear from management soon otherwise I will be contacting the gm of the food court.
author: Jasmin T.

description:
Generally food court's at the mall are pretty meh but Caffe Central is one of Westfeild Mall's hidden gems.
Great quality food for a low price and they even do 50% off on what is left over at the end of the day.
If you're a coffee drinker, they do pour-over style coffee so it can be a little bit of a wait...say it with me "This is NOT Starbucks" with that said,the coffee is superb!! 
They do sandwiches,salads, pastries ,coffee and tea as well as boba! 
Everyone there is super friendly and the service is fast even if there is a long line,
author: Samantha T.

description:
NOTE: Strictly for their milk teas.

I bought a small Taro Milk Tea with boba for $3.50, and although the size was plenty perfect for me, the taste was not. I was really craving my taro, and this stuff was not okay. It tasted extremely bland, with hardly any powdered taro and not that much milk either. 

My friend waited significantly longer than I did, probably around 10 minutes, compared to 5 minutes, for her lychee green tea with mango jelly. Hers was really tart but that's what green tea tastes like, so I preferred her over mine and we pretty much traded drinks. 

In the end, I would really discourage anyone getting milk tea from here, particularly the taro milk tea.
author: Erika S.

description:
Bakery and cafe in the food court of Westfield mall of San Francisco on the bottom floor.

Drink:
1. Small Milk Tea no pearls: The small is huge which was perfect for me since I usually order larges. It is a sweet milk tea which was so delicious. I like all milk teas and have definitely tasted an assortment of on the verge of bitter to extremely sweet. This is a good balance.

Ambience: More of a take out place. Offers different pastries, sandwiches, wraps, and salads displayed in a case. Many people dine in the food court area.

Customer Service: Thoughtful and considerate. I found out afterward I could order honey in my tea which they mix into the blend. They also offered to try the current blend I had now, advising that the honey mixed in makes it very sweet. I stayed with my original order then.

Overall I would recommend because the bubble tea is delicious. I intend to try the other flavors in the future.
author: Krisha A.

description: Moon Le liked this placed. She got passion fruit tea and pomegranate tea the next day.
author: San B.

description:
Caffe Central is in the food court of the Westfield Mall Downtown SF location.  I've walked by a bunch of times & finally stopped to get something.

They have lots of ready made food so it's fast & pretty cheap.  I got Barley & Kale salad small container $4. It's $8.50/lb.  Got it to go & ate it standing outside waiting for the BOM lottery at the Curran Theatre - didn't get the ticket.

They sell Blue Bottle Coffee & make the drinks there.  Sandwiches & other salads available.

You can charge it!
author: Ann L.

description:
I walked by this place, glanced at their pastries and saw fruit tarts!!! My favorite! While my boyfriend was paying I stood in front of the pastries. There was a lady there wearing gloves and cleaning the counter tops with Windex and a rag. I watched the cashier, open the door to the pastry shelves, motion to the lady who was cleaning the counter tops to grab the pastry and place it in the to-go container. I was shocked!!!! Those gloves she was wearing had Windex and dirt from the counter!! As the young guy handed me the box with the fruit tart I refused to take it and told him what I saw! I asked for another one and he rolled his eyes!
He then went and grabbed tongs, grabbed a fruit tart and put it in a new container for me. How hard is that?! Laziness is unacceptable!
The fruit tart on the other hand was delicious!
author: Majileen C.

description: This place would of received 4 stars or better as the food and coffee is good but the service is awful! If you sit at the counter waiting for your order bring lots of patience with you!  The folks preparing your meals are rude and wants to charge you again for an order you did not receive! Make sure to save your receipt!  I ate here when it first opened and the service was 5 stars, I believe the owners were running the place but now good luck!
author: Fabio R.

description:
This café has so many different options to eat and drink...Blue Bottle coffee, freshly squeezed juices, BOBA...ahhh boba. Food options vary from sandwiches, sushi, all kinds of pastries, cheesecakes, etc. I don't know if it's all good, but the boba  I ordered was wonderful. It comes in two sizes and the cup sizes are very generous for the price. I ordered a taro-coconut with boba, and the tapioca was sweet and soft. We shared a very berry tart and it was quite good too. Nice shortbread crust. 

I would come back to try more of their offerings. Great location too.
author: Mel L.

description:
I have been eyeing this place for a few weeks now. Their pastries and sandwich display looked very tempting and I was able to come back last week to give it a try. We ordered:
Portobello arugula sandwich: 3/5 this was ok
Mozzarella eggplant  sandwich: 5/5 delicious. Cheese was fresh, eggplant had great flavor. 
Quinoa salad: 5/5 nice clean citrus taste. 
Apple tart: 4/5 fantastic way to end our lunch date. Good portion and sweet but not overly sweet. 
Prices are decent. Can't wait to try more of their pastries.
author: Kim l.

description:
Mayo madness.

Chicken olivieh sandwich looked awesome. Mix of organic chicken breast, carrots, peas, olivieh, potatoes and eggs on a roll.

Most offerings are already made but they were out and made one fresh. No aioli was no problem. As was a free side of hummus. Such a friendly staff. Appreciated it all.

What was not asked was the definition of olivieh: http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Olivier_salad

Loyal readers know mayo is actively avoided. But after finishing this rather generous in size and flavor $5 sandwich decided to retroactively postpone that rule for one day.

Call it temporary madness.
author: Jason B.

description:
A few different occasions have found us looking for a snack before continuing on our way & Caffe Central has been a delish discovery

The go-to ( at least so far ) is their Hummus Sandwich - lettuce, tomato, sprouts, & *tons* of avocado.  The hummus itself was smooth, mildly spiced but very flavorful, & not lemony....it was a creamy-dreamy delight

The Mr pulled yet another genius move & asked it to be toasted & this sent that little sandwich into the stratosphere - the french roll was perfectly crunchy on the outside yet soft on the inside & the fixings were heated up just right.  This was sandwich perfection!

Around 6pm, you'll also find that many of their premade sandwiches go on sale to half-price & if that's not another bonus-factor, I don't know what else is

And next on my list to try is their Cuban Latte - a latte that uses condensed milk?!  Sign. Me. Up.

HUGE fans!
author: Adrienne G.

description:
A great little find in the food court at Westgate Mall. This place is located on the bloomingdales side and offers a variety of premium cafe style foods, such as, pastries, sandwiches, salads, quiche, and desserts. They also offer blue bottle coffee here. 

I got a roast beef sandwich with a side of summer watermelon salad. (which you can add on for 2$) The sandwich was pretty large. It came on this awesome bread. They ask you if you want it toasted and I'm glad I opted for a toasted sandwich. The bread comes out perfectly crispy and the cheese was slightly melted. I really enjoyed my sandwich.

My boyfriend got a croque monsieur and a cuban iced coffee. It's a really cheesy sandwich with a little bit of ham on the inside. I'm not joking when I say really cheesy, it's a cheese overload! He did not like it that much. He said the bread was soggy and it was really greasy. The cuban coffee, on the other hand, was amazing! I highly recommend it. I was pretty bummed that I didn't get one of my own. 

Prices are pretty decent considering it's in sf.
author: Stacey L.

description:
This is my preferred spot to caffeinate when I am in the Westfield mall. They serve Blue Bottle, which everyone knows is top-shelf coffee. Prices are a bit spendy ($4.00 for a twelve ounce latte, 50 cents extra for soy or almond milk), but it's worth it. 

It's now 4:22pm; I ordered my drink about five minutes ago, and it is one of the best soy lattes I've had. Rich, creamy, smooth, with a nice foamy top and a pretty rosetta on top. Oh, and the barista was pretty handsome, to boot! 

I'm so happy to have a legit place to re-fuel. I was in great need of an energy boost, as I was literally falling asleep at a table. 

All coffees and lattes seem to be served to-go. I would definitely tack another star on if they had ceramic cups to enjoy "for here". The mall has free wi-fi, so you can goof around on the internet as you sip your brew... or just write more Yelp reviews. ;)
author: Brandi W.

description:
I worked at a nearby retail store for about two years and came here nearly every single day for a New Orleans Iced Coffee.

Max points for the coffee and max points for the service. I still miss going down to the ground floor of Westfield and chopping it up with the owner on my lunch breaks.
author: Sebastian C.

description:
Blue Bottle Coffee is the only reason why I came here for the first time.  Although there is blue bottle cafe half block away, I decided to check this place out.
Ordered latte and bagel/cream cheese on my first visit.  on the second visit, I ordered latter and bage/avocado/egg sammy.

First:  coffee is bad.  latte was bland and didn't taste like a blue bottle coffee.  Starbucks even have better latte and there's nothing good to that comparison.  I think if your place is advertising blue bottle, your coffee should be the same if not better as the ones that you can get from blue bottle cafe.  

Second: bagel/avocado/egg.  I was expecting just those 3 things in my sandwich since the label didn't say anything else.  to my surprise, it had onions, lettuce, tomato.  I just think there should be more information on the label especially with ingredients that have bold flavor.

Service were great tho.  That I don't have any complain at all.
Their other sandwiches look promising but ask what else is in there if you're a bit picky.
author: Learnee L.

description: Coffee was good but the hummus avocado toast was not. The avocado had lots of bruises, and when they offered to toast it, I thought they meant toast the bread. No. The sandwiches are pre-made and they toast the whole thing. Warm avocado, warm cucumber, wilty sprouts, and the bread was just, like, steamed. Bleh.
author: Leslie B.

description:
I've been a frequent customer of this food shop since they opened a few years ago.  I just didn't think to add my 2 cents about it on Yelp until today because of what I had this afternoon: Grilled Garden Salad with Chicken.  Such a tasty mélange of vegetables (asparagus, yellow squash, cherry tomato, eggplant) roasted and tossed in vinaigrette with some diced chicken thrown in.  The vegetables were cooked just enough to bring out their flavor but retained their crispiness and their essence.  This was a recent addition on their salad menu and I fervently wish that they keep it on offer.  

But in general, I just love being able to have quality food at the amount I want, so I don't end up overeating or having to take food home that I may not want later.  

Occasionally changing some offers keep the more regular customers' interests, just make sure the garden salad is offered often!!
author: Yvette F.

description: Coffee is DELICIOUS and STRONG! I had the Cuban Mocha...or maybe columbian...lol...they were all so different and unusual to me. If the employees could have explained the differences or if they even smiled, this would have been 5 stars. The coffee here really is delicious! What an unexpected treat! We went to u ion square Mac to get our make up done and just got lucky by passing this gem! YUM!!! And get ready to be wired! Lol! I got the smallest size mocha and zinggggg! Same with my friend, but she had a latte. We both wanted to go back the next day...1.8 miles in the city equals like 20 minutes in the car though lol. ;)
author: Jasmine H.

description:
Lattes and cappuccinos were great, but the blueberry bread pudding wasn't. Desserts are a bit pricey, but it's San Francisco, so that's expected.

However it's a good place to get coffee other than the typical Starbucks/Peets. And it's nearby all the shopping stores
author: J S.

description: Pretty good sandwich and salad place in the mall. I got the special of the day which was a half prosciutto and mozzarella sandwich and choice of side salad for $5.95. It's a pretty good deal! The bread is really good and the sandwich comes toasted. You get a choice of one of 8 different kinds of salad. It's a great value for lunch!
author: Sherry L.

description: Wow: $5.25 for a small latte and no cinnamon or other accoutrement. Also, subpar latte. Soooo overpriced!
author: Jessica K.

description: Nice boba drinks and interesting lunch offerings. Came for coffee but tried the boba drinks instead and they were good.  So much competition for food and drinks in this food court so this place had to be good to stay in business.
author: Steve T.

description: I only get one thing here-- it's the Cuban Latte made with soy milk.  If you've never tried it, you must.  Frothy, creamy, sweet (but not overly so), and altogether yummy.  It's almost as good as a "Cortadito" in Miami. The barrista's here are also really good at making designs on the top of your foam.  It's a nice touch that I don't get to see very often.
author: Lorie N.

description:
Caffe Central might be my new favorite spot to eat at in the mall. 

Serving up fresh Blue Bottle Coffee and stocking an impressive selection of organic teas, they've also mastered a slew of healthy robust sandwiches as well as a lovely selection of pre-made salads.

I am now officially addicted to their barley salad, which for a small serving only comes to about $2.50 and is jam-packed with kale, red bell peppers, barley, some garlic, and drizzled in olive oil. It's divine tasting, healthy for you, and filling too.

Also check out their friends and family cards - which are a nice incentive for return customers.

I'm looking forward to squeezing this healthy eatery into my lunchtime rotation. 

Trust.
author: Jessica T.

description:
Strolled into the Westgate Mall in search of a bathroom, refreshments and French Macarons to take home to my family during my trip to SF.

After walking from one district to another, my friend and I decided to grab some coffee. We saw Caffe Central and it's glowing "Blue Bottle Coffee" sign and told her I've never had it. An abundance of Instagram photos and FB photos of this famous coffee and I've never had it, so we decided to grab drinks here.

I just opted for a Cafe Au Lait and sat to chit chat at a nearby table.

The coffee was prepared with finesse and tasted amazing. I used to be a coffee addict and cut out caffeine out of my life about a year ago completely, making me, a now, jittery mess whenever I consume it. I didn't find that with my drink, I added a bit of raw sugar to lighten up the flavor and it was perfect. Not bitter, or watered down. Perfectly roasted tasting coffee with a slight sweetness.

Definitely a great pick me up! Can't wait to try Blue Bottle from their actual cafes, if this is how it tastes like from a food court.
author: Janet N.

description:
I stopped here after dinner for a little dessert and was excited to see they were having an "end of day sale, top shelf only."  I spotted a raspberry chocolate tart on the top shelf that looked pretty good, so I stepped up to the counter and placed my order.  The worker played the tart for me, then charged me $6.50.  I asked her why it wasn't half price, and then she told me it was only for the one case.  This wasn't clearly marked- in fact, by placing the sign nearly in the middle of the two cases, it made it appear that all "pastries, salads, and sandwiches top shelf only" we're half price. 

Against my better judgement, I paid for the pastry and ate it right at the food court. The tart was fine but certainly not worth the price- the berries were fresh and the tart crust was good. It's just hard to enjoy a treat  after you've been tricked.
author: Daniel H.

description:
I don't expect much from a mall food court, even if it's at the Westfield, but this place was very tasty.  I opted for the salads which all sell for $8.50/lb.  I got about $5 worth of kale and barely salad, beet salad and tuna salad; it was the perfect amount of food. The kale and barely salad was light and crunchy, the beet salad with caramelized onions was sweet and earthy, and the tuna salad was light--not too much mayo--and had the right amount of crunch from the celery and onions.

The sandwiches look promising and they serve Blue Bottle.  They had a daily special too, which includes half a sandwich and salad of your choice for $5.95.
author: Thi D.

description: Ordered an Vienna egg sandwich and the cashier had such an attitude. She first went grab some pastry right after I ordered, so I told her that's not the one. She looked at me with her stinky eyes and said I knew what you wanted while smashing that poor pastry, she grabbed it, put it in the box and slashed the box on top of the counter. I also ordered a Cuban latte with nonfat milk. The guy made it with regular milk and only put under the steamer for like 3 seconds. Of course, my latte was not hot at all. Wondering why such place still have business. Every time, I come to this foodcourt with a huge regret if I dare to give them another try. I'll never come here for any food ever again. Terrible!
author: Ginny W.

description: Great coffee and food, and a GREAT staff!   Cheers to the person who does the hiring there, a good staff goes a long way!
author: Randy J.

description: I come here almost everyday. Their menu is perfect for me. I love Rawsome Tuna Salad, organic, spicy & well ingredient. I love affogato which I drink everyday. They're the only people that make my drinks perfect.
author: Ely T.

description: I work in the area and I tried it because the food looked like it would be pretty good. It was OK. But the staff seemed a little clueless and really not too friendly. I eat in the mall almost everyday but will most likely not be eating here again. If the food was a bit better it may make up for staff.
author: Tiffany F.

description:
A little coffee stand in the middle of the food court. Yes, the coffees and espressos do take a while, but I think that's the charm of an SF coffee shop, as opposed to going to a Starbucks which is on the other side of the food court. (Not that I don't like Starbucks, but they're the fast food of coffee shops).

They do drip coffees and espressos with Blue Bottle Coffee, and also have TCHO for mochas and hot chocolates. The coffees come well made, with a little coffee art (even when they only do take-out orders). Sometimes it's ok to take a little time and relax while you wait for the coffee :)
author: Alice C.

description:
The pastries and desserts are shielded by glass to tempt you more.  Although they look enticing, the taste leaves something to be desired.  The breads aren't moist or flavorful especially the banana walnut tea bread.  Moreover ,the fruit strips are cold and lack flavors.  With everything refrigerated, the food loses its flavor with the exception of its salads and sandwiches.

Service is fast, since it's already made.  Water is self-serve.  Seating is ample in the mall.
author: Jenny L.

description:
Coming from a place where Starbucks is found on every corner, where those who don't drink coffee become the outcasts of our society :) It was definitely surprising that the coffee here at Caffe Central is a place worth having. 

During my foodie road trip, I made several stops by this cafe. Each morning I treated myself to their individual drip coffee; Fresh and Robust. Along with my morning joe, I treated myself to a few of their pastries. With a large selection to choose from, I opted for classics and my favorite, a cheese Danish.

The cheese danish was at best ordinary; nothing special.

Their croissant was flaky, but again it didn't wow me.

The surprising and the easy to miss best dish would have to be their tuna sandwich with granny smith apples. I had mine toasted, which gave it a nice texture to the bread. The apples gave the sandwich a distinctive and unique character. It provided a nice contrasting tartness to the rich tuna. I highly recommend it for a great pick me up. 

The service was a hit and miss. As other reviews note exceptional service, I guess I was unfortunate and fell under a miss. 

I have to say treat every customer with respect. We are the customer, everyone deserves service with care.

Caffe Central is a great spot to start your day or for a little pick me up. But be aware where the service there seems to fluctuate.
author: Rose M.

description: Coffee ok but disappointingly small cups for above average prices (based on size). Cakes ok but cookies are dry and lack taste. The staff were very busy having private conversations which meant they gave no attention to customers. There are a multitude of other options in this food hall so unless you have a particular fondness for this chain, I'd recommend taking your business elsewhere.
author: John B.

description: Another spot to score some Blue Bottle coffee. The owner is an interesting guy that has stories about how he got here. Go talk to him. They sell lots of eats and teas also but, in the middle of all this mall food, it's good to know you can score some quality caffeine.
author: Kim N.

description:
stumbled across this place as we walked out of the structure!

Pros:
- wide selection (coffee, boba, juices)
- they have blue bottle coffee
- convenient location
- central latte

Overall:
4 stars. Convenient location for me at the time since we had just parked. Was debating between the central latte and the cuban latte and decided on the central. Pretty good and tasty. I want to come back to try the cuban next. It wasn't too crowded - couldn't find any cons minus the fact that the service was just average (as compared to Starbucks when I'm used to getting stellar service)
author: Thu H.

description:
Their coffee is very good. I got the Vietnamese iced-coffee and it was the perfect fuel to get me started for my shopping trip! The coffee was strong and perfectly sweetened. I tried my friend's New Orlean's iced-coffee and it was just okay. She tried mine and said she wished she'd gone for the Vietnamese instead. 

I would've given more stars if it weren't for the rude barista. I went when it was slightly busy and the system for getting your drink wasn't very organized. My friend ordered before me and the guy called her drink out with the wrong name, but it was definitely her order. Since I ordered after her and there was a drink that had been sitting out for awhile, I asked him what it was. He wouldn't answer me and just kept calling the name on the cup even though no one was responding to it. I didn't even touch the cup but he grabbed it away when I asked what it was, as if I were a criminal who was going to grab and run. At coffee places, sometimes they get people's names wrong. That's why I asked. He didn't need to be a such a dick about it. I did eventually get my drink and he called out the right name. Hopefully he won't be there the next time I go.
author: Nancy C.

description:
4.5 Stars, strictly for their milk teas.

This little place in the Westfield Food Court is my go-to place for boba. My school just a block away so I come here quite often (maybe 3-4 times a week!)

They use real black and green tea and add milk powder. Now, don't be shocked, I have worked at boba places before and I know that this is how GOOD milk tea is made. Their tea to powder ratio is just right and the resulting milk tea is perfect consistency (not powdery at all! They mix it very well). Also, you can still taste the flavor of the tea (something I look for while judging a milk tea place).
They adjust the sugar they add to your drink based on your request. I usually get no sugar because I love the slight bitterness of tea and added honey boba makes my drink sweet enough. That being said, they have one cashier who seems to doubt my order and always ask me whether or not I am 100% sure I want no sugar "because your drink will taste like tea"... well DUH. its called milk TEA?! But other than that one cashier, the rest of the staff are nice and experienced. I have gone so much that they recognize me now :)

Their small size is usually a "large" at other boba places and is only $3.50! They also offer a student discount and that lowers my boba price to less than $3.00. So cheap for boba, love it.
That price also INCLUDES boba OR aloe vera in the milk tea. How awesome is that? Usual milk tea places usually charge extra for that! You can both into your drink for an extra fee tho. (Although one time I asked for half boba, half aloe, and the cashier didn't charge me... but another time it was that one cashier... she charged me extra and didn't give me my student discount...I'll avoid her now).

Awesome place to get a drink or desserts if you are in the food court and looking for something sweet!

They also have a drinks stamp card.. Every 10th drink is free!
author: Jessica L.

description: My go to spot for boba in this area! Honey Black Milk Tea is my usual. They also have great small sandwiches and salads. The ladies here are awesome and always greet me with a friendly smile.
author: Tiffany P.

description:
I like coming to this cafe in the middle of the Westfield SF Center food court because for one they serve Blue Bottle Coffee.  They also make Vietnamese Iced Coffee and New Orleans Coffee, which are both great when you need a pick me up! 

This kiosk spot also serves sandwiches, salads, pastries, and pasta if you want some food to go along with a beverage.
author: Caroline A.

description: One of the best Cafe Mocha I've had.  I've got to try their other items next time.
author: J W.

description:
I buy the prepared food (salads) here twice a week.  I appreciate that it is sold by weight so I know how much I am eating each time.  And I appreciate the reasonable price.  Considering the price I think Caffe Central is very good.

I have been unable to find contact information for Caffe Central management.  I did not want to air this complaint publicly, but it seems the only way.  I tried to explain to Caffe Central staff, but to no avail.  Caffe Central uses hard plastic containers for take out.  They snap shut in the corners.  No matter how careful I am when I open them the corners break.  I want to reuse the containers, but they are always broken.  

Because I buy take out every day of the week I bring my own containers to other places who fill them up.  Caffe Central staff refuses to do so.  I tried to explain that my containers weigh more than Caffe Central's and I don't mind paying the premium.  But no.  I was told Caffe Central's scale is calibrated specifically for its own containers and no others would be accepted.  

I hope Caffe Central will read this review and purchase containers that can be reused.  I feel guilty about about how much I consume and am trying to live more sustainably.
author: Robin C.

description:
I was looking for some lunch and coffee to buy some time waiting for my bf when I stopped at Caffe Central. They serve Blue Bottle Coffee, and a variety of food options (which I did not partake it).

I opted for the Vietnamese iced coffee which gave me the kick of sugar and the great blend of coffee that I was looking for. I can't say much about their other drinks, but I didn't have to wait too long despite being in a super busy mall location. The employees were all quite nice. I sat nearby afterward, chowing down and studying, and the barista asked how I was enjoying my drink many customers later.

Good service, good drink. Not much else to ask for in a coffee joint in a mall. Will definitely hit this place instead of going to Peet's next time!
author: Alison C.

description: I came here to try their Cuban Coffee and it was amazing!!! I've always just had their regular Blue Bottle drip which is always good along with their delicious pastries... Handmade Tiramisu is my favorite.
author: Liliana M.

description: Horrible customer service. Management or owners need to take some training course on how to deal with customers and resolve issues. For is way over priced and non of the employees know what the hell is going on back their. I would never go back and I will make sure I let others know not to waist their money or time their. I give this place 3 chances all of them fail worse then the previous visits.
author: Arash B.

description:
Terrible experience. Went here during my lunch hour and was very disappointed. I had a tuna sandwich. It took ages, cost $8.50 for a tiny sandwich and a few store-brand tortilla chips, and was dry as hell's steps.

Probably the worst place to go in that food court, at least based on my experience. Barely passable for a 3$ lunch but horrendous for $8.50.
author: Edward H.

description:
Food:  3.5 stars; sandwiches are pretty reliable.  Definitely a better choice than most of the goopy food court places.

Service: 1 star; sometimes feels like you're part of a social experiment.  Cashier chatting with other employees as the long line of customers stands around frustratingly trying to figure out what's wrong with this picture.
author: Andrew W.

description:
Wow... it's pretty darn crazy and cool how such a place exists at the very bottom floor of the mall. I've been to this mall a handful of times when I'm in San Francisco but I thought it was too fancy to have a food court, but even they're food court is fancy. Hahaha.

My boyfriend and I came here on an early Saturday morning where not too many people were frolicking at the mall yet and ordered a mocha and a cappuccino. It was my very, very first time ordering a cappuccino (I love the designs they do on the coffee) and wow, it is damn strong (stronger than what I'm used to). It definitely woke me up =) We also ordered a nutella twist which was awesome (I love Nutella). So it was a very successful "breakfast" I shall say. Now I know where to go and where the food court is whenever I visit this mall.

Makes me wanna try out other cafes just so I can order more cappuccinos and pastries =)
author: Jorgess M.

description:
This place won me over because of the fact that they serve their salads by the pound.  Also because they serve Blue Bottle Coffee.

I usually get fairly hungry after work.. but not hungry enough to fill up on a full meal.  One of my main gripes about the Westfield Food Court establishments is that most of the "small portion" food cost almost as much as a full meal.  Their salad by the pound prices are very reasonable, considering it's in this food court, and very tasty as well.

I ordered the Pesto Penne and the Caprese Salad.  I'm a major fan of their Caprese Salad.  It seems way more fresh than nearby Pasta Moto, and again, at a fairer price.

Next time I come here, I'll be ordering one of the specialty espresso drinks.  They have a couple different kinds of Lattes that I find intriguing.
author: Krystal Nina L.

description: Okay, so it's kinda lame to go to the mall to get blue bottle coffee but it has several advantages over Mint Plaza, 1) it's right next door to my office so if I want a quick coffee fix or am in the mall shopping anyway, 2) there isn't usually a line or if there is it moves really fast compared to Mint Plaza. Caffe Central is still the secret blue bottle fix - so far hardly anyone in the office knows about it.  So take advantage of this.  I recommend the New Orleans iced coffee - not sweet but not too bitter.  Very refreshing but a big cup of caffeine.  Also recommend the Cuban Latte which is like a hot Vietnamese coffee, mixed with condensed milk, tastes like coffee candy. The pastries are just okay - stick to the coffee.
author: Jean K.

description: They serve blue bottle coffee here... haven't had it yet because I was craving tea on my first visit. The people were super nice. The treats & food looked tasty (I was saving room for a special dinner). I will definitely will go back for coffee & treats.
author: Dawn R.

description: This place opened recently in the mall.  I am excited to have another coffee option that is closer than the other Blue Bottle location off of 5th.  Especially since the Peet's in this same location is the slowest Peet's on the planet.  I had the New Orleans iced coffee and it was delicious.  I just wish that Blue Bottle carried more medium and light roasts instead of all dark roasts but I'm happy this is now open.  The people who work here are quick and friendly.
author: Amanda K.

description:
This review is for the salads!

Caffe Central has a tantalizing array of salads.  Options include (but are not limited to) cajun corn & kale, quinoa, pesto penne, chicken salad, roasted beet, tuna, greek, and caprese.  Priced at $7.95 a pound, this food emporium island offers arguably the most affordable healthy lunch within eyesight!
author: Kate J.

description: Amazing coffee. I recommend the pour over of one of the extremely dark roasts, or a cappuccino because there is a really attractive male barrista who will give you latte art. Extra points if he makes it into a heart. They exclusively brew blue bottle coffee, and blue bottle coffee is everything. So go here when you're at the mall. Not Peets, Not Starbs, and its extremely rude to ask for free samples at Bloomingdales unless you're actually buying a Nespresso Machine. So save yourself the embarrassment of looking cheap, and go here, because its like 50 feet away from Bloomingdales.
author: Queen B.

description:
I only recently discovered Caffe Central, but I expect to return soon and often. I'm a fan of Blue Bottle Coffee, but sometimes I just don't feel like braving the cold and windy weather to get to Mint Street. But now, I can get properly prepared Blue Bottle drip coffee and espresso drinks right in the Westfield concourse. 

The wait for my drip coffee and iced tea was around 10 minutes total, but since the barista started my drip while I was still waiting to pay, I ended up only having to wait a few minutes. 

What more can you ask for from a coffee shop that serves delicious, freshly brewed coffee from a convenient location and prepared by friendly, pleasant bariastas? Nothing that comes to my mind.
author: Jenny C.

description:
Every time I come here, my coffee takes about 10 minutes to appear. Whether the place is busy or not, it just takes way too long.

I understand the Blue Bottle drip process takes some time to brew a cup (at max it should be five minutes), but when you have three baristas in the back not tending to the line of drinks waiting to be made, it can be disappointing.

I really want to like this place since they serve Blue Bottle coffee (going to the actual cafe can be a nightmare at just about any time during the day), but I just need them to speed up service a little bit more.

Initially, this place would have gotten two stars, but I gave them one more for an amazing pastry and salad selection. I have yet to try anything from here, but the selection is vast and extensive, also it's presented beautifully.
author: Trav M.

description: The jasmine milk green tea was amazing, albeit a bit sweet (luckily I love sweet!). I've gotten boba all over the Bay Area (tpumps, purple kow, sharetea, Fantasia...) and I'm quite picky, but both the drink and the pearls were superior. The price is also pretty hard to beat! Nice workers too (:
author: Michele G.

description:
A closer spot that sells Blue Bottle? SOLD. I'll be hitting up this place more often. But so far I've tried one drink and I really enjoyed it. So when I'm haunting new coffee joints, I'm always on the lookout for their signature drink. Something that they have that you can't really find anywhere else (with ease). They've got two and maybe they aren't signatures, but they are unique in a world of SB and Peet's. Central Latte and Cuban Latte. The Cuban Latte is a normal latte however it uses condensed milk -- I haven't tried it just yet.

The Central Latte however is a latte with a combination of vanilla and caramel. The thing I love about it is that it wasn't syrupy and you didn't get an overwhelmingly sweet drink. It was the perfect balance which I loved. 

They also sell Blue Bottle Coffee beans here so that makes it even more legit.
author: Shauna S.

description: This place is fantastic. Great food. Light salads to delicious sandwiches. Blue Bottle coffee and large pastry selection. Service is fast and friendly. Highly recommend.
author: Karina S.

description:
A newly opened cafe in the downstairs food court at the Westfield Mall, Caffe Central has some promise.  You have salads, sandwiches, soups, and a few other things (including Blue Bottle coffee if you swing that way) either freshly made or ready to pick up right there.  I saw quite a few things that caught my eye, some tasty and tempting options that I've not seen offered in the mall food court.  For my first foray there, I had a freshly made tomato/mozzarella sandwich on an olive ciabatta bun and I was not disappointed in the least.

Check this place out, give their sandwiches and salads a shot.  Hopefully they'll be around for awhile, as I think they definitely do fill a niche in the Westfield Mall food court!
author: Cassandra J.

description: Came to this place randomly, but really liked it. Had awesome blue bottle drip coffee and great desserts. My friends tried cheesecake and boba tea and liked it as well. Was surprised by their selection of snacks including fresh spring rolls. I also liked their space - open and comfortable. Will definitely try this again when in area.
author: Ali H.

description: It's possible to get a really good sandwich (both large and small options) with a side salad for between 6 and 9 dollars. Great, fresh food.
author: Luke M.

description: Horrible! Who wants a tepid Mocah!? Not me.  Plus don't ask for my name and then shout out my drink order.  Lame.
author: Elizabeth K.

description:
The little shop is the sole caffé central,
lets hope there will be more.
The Cuban latte at $4 was worth every penny.
No small, medium or large just 1 size. But it's a perfect amount.  The velvety smooth latte will remind you of what a good cup of coffee should be.
So if you can, skip the peets for a moment and give this little guy a try.
author: erik K.

description: Prices are extremely high, plain coffee tastes like water and I had to wait while the guy making itnplayed with his phone.
author: Susan P.

description: I never been here before and was originally going to go to Blue Bottle Coffee down at the Ferry Building but was running short on time so since I was in Westfield, I stumbled across this stand at the basement floor where the food court was. I was weary about their Blue Bottle because I've been to other locations that served Blue Bottle and it was a miss on their New Orleans Ice Coffee and sadly, it was also a miss here as well. The coffee wasn't sweet so I tried to add some sweetener but it was still no good. I think somehow this has confirmed that anyplace that serves Blue Bottle coffee isn't actually the same as the place itself. I can't diss this place just because of one drink and never trying anything else from them so I won't give them a bad rating but from the looks of the price and what-not, everything's okay...
author: Judy C.

description:
worst service ever. here's a review for each jerk-store..

TALL OLD GUY - he doesn't give a fuck. he is mostly looking down on dripping coffee and never turns around

TALL YOUNG GUY - total douchebag vibe. he's always trying to look cool and he doesn't give a fuck either.

GAY DUDE - total hipster shitty service.

OLD ASIAN WOMAN - doesn't give a flying fuck. maybe her co-workers have gotten to her.

YOUNG ASIAN CHICK - totally cool.
author: Razmig M.

description:
It's the only real coffee in the mall!

If you want a stellar cappuccino, it is worth the wait.  

Amazing staff -- friendly and helpful.  They are true alchemists of the coffee world.  


Healthy, fresh, quick food and pastries. 

We love this place.
author: Zack G.

description:
I'm from Seattle and we're a little different about our coffee there. While I often find myself frustrated with slow service in coffee shops here, but not at Caffe Central. I can safely say I have never had to spend more than 5 minutes total to order and collect my coffee here, this may seem like a crazy thing to say but when you only have so much time for your lunch break, every minute is precious. 

Their customer service is also always great, they remember me and say hi every time I am there! 

Lastly, if you haven't ever had one of their lemon cookies you don't know what you are missing out on. They are simply amazing.
author: Brenna L.

description: the mixed fruit tart was super yummie and the focaccia salami sandwich was super delicious toasted ! i also ordered a honeydew milk tea with boba and it was soo good and v cheap for 24oz. i got the sandwich and the pastry half off because an hour before closing they have a half off sale which is pretty tight.
author: Mysterious O.

description:
go for the coffee, and only the coffee

weird grilled cheese for $7 with a "side" of stale tortilla chips?

$3 brownie that we both skipped after one bite?

bottle of root beer that was barely cold?

but the Cuban coffee was quite good (but not true cafecito, but definitely had the unique flavor of Cuban coffee).

we noticed Melt after eating. Dang!
author: Chris K.

description: Wonderful breakfast sandwich and they serve Blue Bottle! I wish I had known that before I bought a Peet's coffee but next time. Also, the staff was sweet as pie.
author: Tracy A.

description: Blue Bottle is my favorite coffee and their quiche is yum.
author: Isaiah B.

description: Blue Bottle Coffee tasty lovelyness in a mall.  The sandwiches are great too. Yes, you can now take BART or MUNI to awesome coffee without going outside.
author: Dave B.

description: I'd rather come here for Blue Bottle instead of the ludicrous line at the Ferry Building.
author: Evan W.

description: Wow these guys are so slow, 20 minutes for a macchiato. Which they then leave sitting for 5 minutes. They were nice enough to remake the drink but they need to speed things up. Coffee was good, prefer four barrel
author: nick w.

description: Love this spot! Super delicious coffees totally make my days. Cuban coffee is my favorite. Very friendly staff, Ehmet is my man.
author: Matt C.
